org.goobi.production.plugin.CataloguePlugin

Class CataloguePlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.goobi.production.plugin.UnspecificPlugin
      • org.goobi.production.plugin.CataloguePlugin.CataloguePlugin

  • public class CataloguePlugin
extends UnspecificPlugin
    The class CataloguePlugin is a redirection class that takes a library catalogue access plugin implementation object as argument. The plugin implementation class can be a POJO that can be compiled without the necessity to link it against the Production code, thus making it possible to provide proprietary plugins that do not violate the GPL. The plugin class must however implement the following public methods which it is checked for upon instantiation. If one of the methods is missing a NoSuchMethodException will be thrown.

    void configure(Map)
    See UnspecificPlugin.

    Object find(String, long)
    The function find() is to perform a search request in a library catalogue. See QueryBuilder for the semantics of the query. It may return an arbitrary Object identifying (or—at the implementor’s choice—containing) the search result. The method shall return null if the search performed normally, but didn’t yield any result. The method shall ensure that it returns after the given timeout and shall throw a javax.persistence.QueryTimeoutException if it was cancelled by the timer. The method may throw exceptions.

    String getDescription()
    See UnspecificPlugin.

    Map getHit(Object, long, long)
    The function getHit() shall return the hit identified by its index. The hit shall be a Map<String, Object> with the fields described in Hit populated. The method shall ensure that it returns after the given timeout and shall throw a javax.persistence.QueryTimeoutException if it was cancelled by the timer. The method may throw exceptions.

    long getNumberOfHits(Object, long)
    The function getNumberOfHits() shall return the number of hits scored by the search represented by the given object. If the object isn’t the result of a call to the find() function, the behaviour of the function may be undefined. The method shall ensure that it returns after the given timeout and shall throw a javax.persistence.QueryTimeoutException if it was cancelled by the timer. The method may throw exceptions.

    String getTitle()
    See UnspecificPlugin.

    void setPreferences(Prefs)
    The method setPreferences() is called before the first search request to the plug-in and passes the UGH preferences the plugin shall use.

    boolean supportsCatalogue(String)
    The function supportsCatalogue() shall return whether the plug-in has sufficient knowledge to query a catalogue identified by the given String literal or not.

    void useCatalogue(String)
    The function useCatalogue() is called before the first search request to the plug-in and shall tell it to use the catalogue connection identified by the given String literal. If the plugin doesn’t support the given catalogue (supportsCatalogue() would return false) the behaviour may be unspecified.

    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

    • Constructor Detail

      • CataloguePlugin

        public CataloguePlugin(Object implementation)
                throws SecurityException,
                       NoSuchMethodException
        CataloguePlugin constructor. The constructor takes a reference to the plug-in implementation class, saves it in the final field plugin and inspects the class for existence of the methods configure, getDescription, getTitle, find, getHit, getNumberOfHits, setPreferences, supportsCatalogue and useCatalogue.
        Parameters:
        implementation - plug-in implementation class
        Throws:
        SecurityException - If a security manager, is present and an invocation of its method checkMemberAccess(this, Member.DECLARED) denies access to the declared method or if the caller’s class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of the security manager’s checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class.
        NoSuchMethodException - if a required method is not found on the plug-in

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public Object find(String query,
                   long timeout)
        The function find() is intended to send a search request to a library catalogue and to return an Object identifying (or—at the implementor’s choice—containing) the search result. The method shall return null if the search didn’t yield any result. The method shall ensure that it returns after the given timeout and shall throw a javax.persistence.QueryTimeoutException in that case. The method may throw exceptions.
        Parameters:
        query - Query string
        timeout - timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        an object identifying the result set

      • getFirstHit

        public static ugh.dl.Fileformat getFirstHit(String catalogue,
                                            String query,
                                            ugh.dl.Prefs preferences)
        The function getFirstHit() returns at random the first hit the catalogue plugin returns for a given query. Making use of this utility method only makes sense if there is only one result expected, which usually is the case if a valid identifier is looked up in its respective column.
        Parameters:
        catalogue - catalogue in question
        query - Query string
        preferences - Prefs object
        Returns:
        UGH preferences

      • getHit

        public Hit getHit(Object searchResult,
                  long index,
                  long timeout)
        The function getHit() shall return the hit identified by its index. The method shall ensure that it returns after the given timeout and shall throw a javax.persistence.QueryTimeoutException in that case. The method may throw exceptions.
        Parameters:
        searchResult - an object identifying the search result
        index - zero-based index of the object to retrieve
        timeout - timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        A map with the fields of the hit

      • getNumberOfHits

        public long getNumberOfHits(Object searchResult,
                            long timeout)
        The function getNumberOfHits() shall return the hits scored by the search represented by the given object. If the object isn’t the result of a call to the find() function, the behaviour may be undefined.
        Parameters:
        searchResult - search result object whose number of hits is to retrieve
        Returns:
        the number of hits in this search

      • getTimeout

        public static long getTimeout()
        The function getTimeout() returns the timeout to be used in catalogue access. This defaults to thirty minutes if no catalogue timeout is set in the configuration

        Note that on large, database-backed catalogues, searches for common title terms may take more than 15 minutes, so 30 minutes may be a fair average between that and the moment the sun will swallow up the earth.

        Returns:
        the timeout for catalogue access

      • getType

        public PluginType getType()
        The function getType() returns the PluginType.Opac as it corresponds to this class.
        Specified by:
        getType in class UnspecificPlugin
        Returns:
        a value from enum PluginType
        See Also:
        UnspecificPlugin.getType()

      • setPreferences

        public void setPreferences(ugh.dl.Prefs preferences)
        The method setPreferences() must be used to set the UGH preferences the plugin shall use.
        Parameters:
        preferences - UGH preferences
        See Also:
        org.kitodo.services.RulesetService#getPreferences()

      • supportsCatalogue

        public boolean supportsCatalogue(String catalogue)
        The function supportsCatalogue() returns whether the plugin has sufficient knowledge to query a catalogue identified by the given String literal.
        Parameters:
        catalogue - catalogue in question
        Returns:
        whether the plugin supports that catalogue

      • useCatalogue

        public void useCatalogue(String catalogue)
        The function useCatalogue() shall tell the plugin to use a catalogue connection identified by the given String literal. If the plugin doesn’t support the given catalogue (supportsCatalogue() would return false) the behaviour is unspecified (throwing an unchecked exception is a good option).
        Parameters:
        catalogue - catalogue in question
